conversation.content: [softly] 我一直在想你会不会回来，马修，虽然说实话，第三年过去了连个电话都没有，我就不再期待了。
[hollow voice] 出事之后我没法面对您，报纸上说的那些...说我在手术时，[exhales]，说我喝醉了做手术，害死了病人。
你以为我不知道你喝酒的事？我在医院干了60年，你爸葬礼那天我就闻到你身上的酒味了，你以为没人看见的时候，我看到你手在发抖。
[defensive] 所以您早就知道？就这么眼睁睁看着我越陷越深，直到有人死在我手术台上？
我能说什么你才会听呢？你是天才外科医生啊，约翰霍普金斯的高材生，各大期刊都发表你的论文，而我呢，只是个过时的老妈妈，还在唠叨什么便盆的事。
您从来都不是"只是"什么，妈，您在急诊室救的人比我多多了，47年，每一个班都清醒着。
[wistful] 你外公也是酒鬼，你知道吗？在车库里藏酒瓶，撞坏了三辆车才被吊销驾照。[sighs]
那把他整个人都毁了。
[quietly] 我不知道这些，您从来没跟我提过他，只说他在我出生前就去世了。
要是我早知道家里有这个病史，也许我会更小心，会注意那些征兆，在太迟之前就去寻求帮助。
或者你还是会做一样的事，觉得自己不一样，觉得自己特别，比基因和家族诅咒都要强大。
亨德森一家上个月来找我，就是那个去世女士的家人，他们想知道我是不是觉得你是个恶魔。[pause]
您怎么说的？说您儿子就像法庭上说的那样，是个自以为是上帝的自恋狂？
[bitter laugh] 我自己的律师都这么说我，想博取陪审团的同情来减轻判决。
[gently] 我跟他们说，你在拿起手术刀之前就已经破碎了，卓越和空虚往往形影不离。[quieter] 他们听了并没有得到安慰。
我其实也没有，因为知道原因并不能挽回什么，不能让他们的女儿活过来，不能让你的职业生涯回来，也不能找回我们失去的这5年。
我现在在五金店工作，您能想象吗？了不起的陈马修在那调漆配钥匙，那些顾客根本不知道我以前是谁。
有时候在柜台听到顾客抱怨身体不适，我差点就要纠正他们，然后想起来我已经不能再给医疗建议了，连拔个刺都不行。[hollow laugh]
[wearily] 到了我这个年纪，原谅就像搬石头，一块比一块重，而我已经没有力气再搬了。
我不是来求原谅的，妈，只是想让您知道我戒酒了，14个月了，还有我每天都在想那个女人，想如果我真的是我装出来的那个医生，她今天会是什么样子。

original_conversation.content: [softly] I wondered if you'd ever come back, Matthew, though honestly I stopped expecting it after the third year passed without even a phone call.
[hollow voice] I couldn't face you after what happened, after everything the papers said about me, about the patient who died because I was, [exhales], because I was drunk during surgery.
You think I didn't know about the drinking? Sixty years in medicine, I could smell it on you at your father's funeral, saw your hands shake when you thought no one was watching.
[defensive] So you knew and said nothing? Just let me spiral until someone died on my table?

What could I say that you would have heard? You were the brilliant surgeon, top of your class at Johns Hopkins, published in every journal, and I was just your ancient mother who still talked about bedpans.
You were never just anything, Mom, you saved more lives in that emergency ward than I ever did, stone-cold sober every single shift for forty-seven years.
[wistful] Your grandfather was an alcoholic too, did you know that? Hid bottles in the garage, crashed three cars before they took his license away. [sighs]
It broke him.
[quietly] I didn't know that, you never told me about him, just that he died before I was born.
Maybe if I'd known there was a history, maybe I could have been more careful, watched for the signs, gotten help before it was too late.
Or maybe you would have done exactly what you did anyway, believing you were different, special, stronger than genetics and family curses.
The Hendersons came to see me last month, the family of the woman who died, wanted to know if I thought you were a monster. [pause]
What did you tell them? That your son was exactly what they said in court, a narcissist who thought he was God?
[bitter laugh] That's what my own lawyer called me, trying to get a lighter sentence by throwing me on the jury's mercy.
[gently] I told them you were broken long before you ever picked up a scalpel, that excellence and emptiness often walk hand in hand. [quieter] They didn't find comfort in that.
Neither did I, really, because knowing why something happens doesn't undo the damage, doesn't bring back their daughter or your career or the five years we've lost.
I work at a hardware store now, can you imagine? The great Matthew Chen mixing paint and cutting keys for people who have no idea who I used to be.
Sometimes I catch myself about to correct someone's medical complaint at the counter, then I remember I'm not allowed to give medical advice anymore, not even about a splinter. [hollow laugh]
[wearily] At my age, forgiveness feels like lifting boulders, each one heavier than the last, and I'm running out of strength for the lifting.

I'm not asking for forgiveness, Mom, just wanted you to know I'm sober now, fourteen months, and that I think about that woman every single day, wonder who she'd be today if I'd been the doctor I pretended to be.

scenario: A 102-year-old former nurse meets with her disgraced surgeon son who lost his license for malpractice and has come to seek reconciliation after years of estrangement.
